revised_title: Initiation and Growth of Explosion in Solids: Part I - Thermal Decomposition, Inflammation, and Detonation
tldr: This article discusses the initiation and growth of explosions in solids, focusing on the distinction between thermal decomposition, inflammation, and detonation. The author explores the role of crystal defects and lattice imperfections in the decomposition process and the critical temperatures at which these processes occur. The article also examines the mechanisms of detonation in various solid explosives, such as nitrogen iodide, lead azide, and barium azide.
